bibl.title: Letter from James C. McKee to the Surgeon General, March 17, 1879

div1.p: McKee approves Reed's request for a month's leave of absence.

div1.head: Letter from James C. McKee to the Surgeon General, March 17, 1879
div1.opener:
Reed W.
A. S. U.S.A
Sec. W.J. Wakeman
A. S. U.S.A
N 343 L.S.O. 1879
Med. Dir. Office Dept. of Arizona
Prescott Bks March 17, 1879.
------------------------
J.C. McKee
Major & Surgeon U.S.A.
Medical Director
------------------------
Leave of absence granted
Dr. Reed Post Surgeon
Camp Apache etc.
2 End
Office Medical Director,
Headquarters Department of Arizona.
Prescott B'ks., A. T., March 17th 1879
To the
Surgeon General U.S.A.
Washington D.C.
Sir:
div1.p:
I would
respectfully inform you that by direction of the General
Commanding a leave of absence for one (1) month
has been granted to Dr. Reed Post Surgeon Camp
Apache A. T. with permission to apply for an extension of
fifteen (15) days for the purpose of taking his family
to the end of R. R. in New Mexico and return to his post.
(Extract of S.O. No 34. C.S. herewith enclosed)
div1.closer:
Very respectfully,
Your Obedient Servant. J.C. Mckee Major & Surgeon U.S.A.
Medical Director
